title: Economic outcomes and levers: impacts for individuals and society

references.title: Alzheimer’s disease in the UK: comparative evidence on cost-of-illness and of health services research funding.
references.raw: Lowin, A., McCrone, P. and Knapp, M. (2001). Alzheimer’s disease in the UK: comparative evidence on cost-of-illness and of health services research funding. International Journal of Geriatric Psychiatry, 16, 1143–1148.

references.title: Assessment of informal services to demented people with the RUD instrument.
references.raw: Wimo, A., Nordberg, G., Jansson, W. and Grafstr¨ om, M. (2000). Assessment of informal services to demented people with the RUD instrument. International Journal of Geriatric Psychiatry, 15, 969–971.

references.title: Cognitive stimulation therapy for people with dementia: cost-effectiveness analysis.
references.raw: Knapp, M. et al. (2006). Cognitive stimulation therapy for people with dementia: cost-effectiveness analysis. British Journal of Psychiatry, 188, 574–580.

references.title: Collaborative Group
references.raw: AD 2000 Collaborative Group (2004). Long-term donepezil treatment in 565 patients with Alzheimer’s disease (AD 2000): randomised double-blind trial. Lancet, 363, 2105–2115.

references.title: Costing psychiatric interventions.
references.raw: Beecham, J. and Knapp, M. (2001). Costing psychiatric interventions. In G. Thornicroft (ed.), Measuring Mental Health Needs (pp. 200–224). London: Gaskell.

references.title: Costs of dementia: a review.
references.raw: J¨ onsson, B., J¨ onsson, L. and Wimo, A. (2002). Costs of dementia: a review. In M. Maj and N. Sartorius (eds.), Dementia. Chichester: Wiley.

references.title: Direct payments in England: factors linked to variations in provision.
references.raw: Fernandez, J.-L., Kendall, J., Davey, V. and Knapp, M. (2007). Direct payments in England: factors linked to variations in provision. Journal of Social Policy, 36, 97–121.

references.title: EuroQol – a new facility for the measurement of health-related quality of life.
references.raw: EuroQol Group (1990). EuroQol – a new facility for the measurement of health-related quality of life. Health Policy, 16, 199–208.

references.title: Evaluating the individual budget pilot projects.
references.raw: Glendinning, C. et al. (2006). Evaluating the individual budget pilot projects. Journal of Care Services Management, 1, 123–128.

references.title: Formal and informal care for people with dementia: variations in costs over time.
references.raw: Schneider, J. et al. (2003). Formal and informal care for people with dementia: variations in costs over time. Ageing and Society, 23, 303–326.

references.title: Principles of applied cost research.
references.raw: Knapp, M. (1993). Principles of applied cost research. In A. Netten and J. Beecham (eds.), Costing Community Care: Theory and Practice. Aldershot: Ashgate.

references.title: Resource utilisation and cost analysis of memantine in patients with moderate to severe Alzheimer’s disease.
references.raw: Wimo, A., Winblad, B., Stofﬂer, A., Wirth, Y. and Mobius, H. (2003). Resource utilisation and cost analysis of memantine in patients with moderate to severe Alzheimer’s disease. Pharmacoeconomics, 21, 327–340.

references.title: Social care: choice, money, control.
references.raw: Knapp, M. (2007). Social care: choice, money, control. In J. Hills, J. Le Grand and D. Piachaud (eds.), Making Social Policy Work: Essays in Honour of Howard Glennerster. Bristol: Policy Press.

references.title: The estimation of a preference-based single index measure for health from the SF-36.
references.raw: Brazier, J., Roberts, J. and Deverill, M. (2002). The estimation of a preference-based single index measure for health from the SF-36. Journal of Health Economics, 21, 271–292.Economic outcomes and levers 495 Brouwer, W., Rutten, F. and Koopmanschap, M. (2001). Costing in economic evaluations. In M. Drummond and A. McGuire (eds.), Economic Evaluation in Health Care: Merging Theory with Practice. Oxford: Oxford University Press.

references.title: Theory versus practice: a review of “willingness to pay” in health and health care.
references.raw: Olsen, J. and Smith, R. (2001). Theory versus practice: a review of “willingness to pay” in health and health care. Health Economics, 10, 39–52.

references.title: Unit Costs of Health and Social Care
references.raw: Curtis, L. and Netten, A. (2005). Unit Costs of Health and Social Care 2006. Canterbury: PSSRU, University of Kent.
